data.title: Former Blue Peter star Zoe Salmon and husband Will Corrie welcome first child
data.meta_description: Former Blue Peter presenter Zoe Salmon and her husband Will Corrie have welcomed their first child together and shared their adorable name choice.
data.text:
Former Blue Peter presenter Zoe Salmon and her husband Will Corrie have welcomed their first child together and shared their adorable name choice.

Zoe Salmon mightâ€™ve left the childrenâ€™s TV classic in 2008, but she likely remains one of many peopleâ€™s favourite Blue Peter presenters to this day. Now she's revealed the exciting news that she and her husband Will Corrie have welcomed a new addition to the family. Zoe took to Twitter to announce sheâ€™s given birth to a baby boy as she posted a sweet black-and-white snap of their little one lying down under a mobile featuring a dangling star.

His tiny feet take centre stage in the photo, with the proud mum keeping her newbornâ€™s face a little more private.

Though thereâ€™s one thing Zoe seemed keen to be open about with fans when it comes to her son and thatâ€™s his unique baby name - and his super cute nickname!

â€œOur little starâ€¦ Fitz (Fitzwilliam) Salmon-Corrieâ€, she declared in her caption, even keeping to the black-and-white theme of the photo with a pale grey heart emoji.

After breaking her and Willâ€™s baby news to fans, many people were quick to congratulate the new mum as they expressed their delight at his sweet name.

â€œCongratulations love the nameâ€, one person wrote excitedly.

Another welcomed Zoeâ€™s little one, replying, â€œGreat photo Zoe. Congrats to you & Will. Welcome to the world Fitzâ€.

â€œOh my goodness. So many congratulations. I am delighted for you. Xâ€, someone else commented.

Whilst a fellow fan expressed their belief that with a name as beautiful and distinguished as Fitzwilliam, a â€œtitleâ€ would work incredibly well.

â€œNeeds a title that wee man. The Honourable Fitzwilliam Salmon-Corrie Many congratulations to you bothâ€, they said.

Zoe first announced her pregnancy in October 2021 with an adorable snap of her and Will looking adoringly at each other.

She wrote simply, â€œğŸ¤ğŸŒ… Our fairy tale continuesâ€¦we have been carrying a little secretâ€¦an extra heartbeat ğŸ¤âœ¨ We are over the moonğŸŒ™ ğŸ‘¶ğŸ» Coming soonâ€¦ğŸ¤â€.

Opening up about growing their family to the Belfast Telegraph at the time, Zoe described being pregnant as â€œsurrealâ€ as they didnâ€™t think theyâ€™d get pregnant so quickly.

â€œIt feels quite surreal. Every day I wake up feeling so happy and content. Will and I have been together for 10 years and married for five,â€ she said, before adding, â€œWe talked about starting a family and agreed the time was right, but I didnâ€™t think it would happen straight away.â€

She continued, â€œWe are both so excited at the thought of this magical new addition to our family. Itâ€™s a real fairytale moment for us after such a crazy year and a half and we are so pleased we can share this lovely news with our families and friends.

"We see this pregnancy as a lovely gift and the timing is just perfect for us. I really couldnâ€™t be any happier.â€
